bio:treatment.description: Plants to 1(–2.5) cm. Stem leaves loosely erect to flexuose when dry, erect-spreading when moist, 2–4 mm; base not decurrent; margins entire or subentire; apex sharply acuminate-acute; costa wide, ending well before apex; laminal cells pellucid. Sexual condition autoicous. Seta 1.2–4 cm. Capsule 2–3 mm. Spores 30–40 µm.
Rotting wood, organic soil, rich fens scattered across boreal zone;
Alta., B.C., Man., Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.), N.W.T., Nunavut, Ont., Que., Yukon; Alaska, Colo., Mich., Minn., Mont., Wis., Wyo.; Europe; Asia.
bio:treatment.discussion: Amblyodon dealbatus is distinguished from species of Meesia by its lax, thin-walled laminal cells.
